articles.title: World’s oldest curler Ralph Vaccaro, a WWII veteran and ocean researcher, dies at 99
articles.description: Ralph Vaccaro, 99, of West Falmouth, who died April 16, was a World War II Army veteran, a Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution researcher, and was certified by Guinness World Records as the world’s oldest curler.
articles.content:
Morning after morning, Ralph Vaccaro stood on the ice and studied the path his curling stone would travel. Though he only took up the sport in his 80s, he brought nearly a century of life wisdom to each contest and the careful concentration of a scientist.
